biography.content:
Farshid Chini was born in Tehran, Iran, in 1981. He received the B.Sc. degree in mechanical engineering from Amirkabir University of Technology, Tehran, Iran, in 2003.  Then he moved to Edmonton, Alberta, Canada to pursue his academic path at the University of Alberta, home to the largest nanotechnology institute in Canada and one of the finest in the world (NINT).  He received his M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in mechanical engineering from the University of Alberta. 

During his Ph.D. and for two years after that he worked in some HVAC and Oil and gas industry as consultant and project manager. He managed some over $10M projects in Alberta and Northwest Territories, Canada.

In 2014, he returned to his hometown and started working as an assistant Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, at the University of Tehran, one of the most prestigious Engineering schools in the middle-east.
Dr. Chini is also the head of Roshd Center in Parsian, Iran, a research center at the heart of South Pars Gas field which is the biggest gas field in the world, shared between Iran and Qatar.

His current research interests include surface engineering, sustainable energy and drop analysis. He was the recipient of a numerous research and teaching awards during his academic path. Among them are: Queen Elizabeth II Graduate Scholarship-Doctoral level, 2012, The Mary Louise Imrie Award, 2011, TD Insurance Meloche Monnex Award for Outstanding Service, 2011, Sadler Graduate Scholarship2009, Alberta Ingenuity 601, 2008, Germany Travel Award, 2007.
